title: Anchorage Capital hauled into CF Asia Pacific sale
text:
Australian buyout firm Anchorage Capital Partners is in late stage talks to buy coal haulage contractor CF Asia Pacific.

Street Talk understands Anchorage had a close look at the integrated rail services provider a few years ago, and recently re-opened the deal file following an all-but-failed sale process and an approach from CF Asia Pacific and its owner Sasser Family Holdings from the United States.

Anchorage Capital Partners is closing in on privately-owned transportation business CF Asia Pacific. iStock

Anchorage is making late-stage preparations for a transaction, including registering a family of new companies with the corporate regulator that would be home to the business.

The deal expected to be signed early next week, sources said.

CF Asia Pacific, at its heart, is a leasing business which leases trains and carriages to coal companies needing to shift coal.
description: Anchorage Capital Partners is in late stage talks to buy coal haulage contractor CF Asia Pacific.
